meanings.sent1: After running, I felt so winded and had to sit down to catch my breath.
meanings.sent2: The runner was too winded to continue the race at the same pace.
meanings.sent3: Even the squirrel looked winded after racing around the tree multiple times.
meanings.sent4: The winded puppy panted heavily after chasing its tail in circles.
meanings.sent5: The winded child's face turned red as he struggled to keep up with the others.

meanings.sent1: The river took a winded path through the forest, twisting and turning along the way.
meanings.sent2: The hiking trail became more challenging as it followed a winded route up the mountain.
meanings.sent3: The winded road through the countryside offered scenic views at every turn.
meanings.sent4: The winded maze in the garden confused visitors with its many twists and turns.
meanings.sent5: The winded path through the park led to a hidden pond at the end.

meanings.definition: To have the wind knocked out of one
meanings.sent1: He accidentally fell off the swing, causing him to be winded for a moment.
meanings.sent2: The boxer was winded by a powerful punch to the stomach during the match.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected jump scare in the movie winded the audience with shock.
meanings.sent4: The sudden gust of wind winded the kite flyer, making him lose control of his kite.
meanings.sent5: The intense roller coaster ride winded the thrill-seeker, leaving him exhilarated and breathless.
